data.title: Just OK
data.text:
Very pedestrian Italian resto. Sketchy service. "Oh, you had a salad too?" 
Better than a chain though but not by much.

data.title: My Birthday Choice
data.text: Loccino's is my annual choice for my birthday feast. The lamb chops with garlic mashed potatoes and greenie beanies can't be beat! i

data.title: Good food
data.text: We went last night - this happens to be restaurant week so we ordered the special which included an appetizer, salad, entree and dessert. I had the fried artichokes which were pretty good. The caesar salad was okay .. pretty small and the dressing was more of a vinaigrette. The chicken marsala was very good - the sauce was yummy and the chicken was tender.  The cannoli was just okay but I tried my husbands cheesecake and that was very good. It's a bit pricey for what you end up getting. I would probably go to Carraba's or Macaroni Grill before I would come back here. They were very busy so the service was a bit slow. But our waiter was very attentive when he had time.

data.title: superb food & service!
data.text: I was there for a luncheon after a funeral and we were welcomed with open arms! Not only did they have an area set off to the side for us but the Waiters were so very helpful, courteous & friendly ...guiding us to where we were, making sure we had beverages immediately. Once we ordered our lunches they were quick to bring their delicious bread with garlic dip out with our salads...of which the house dressing is amazing! When our main entrees came everyone was very pleased at not only the portion size of the meal but how delicious each of our meals were. This restaurant is a must! Pleasant atmosphere, great food & superb service!

data.title: Good Itslian
data.text:
Nice and close to home with easy access on Crooks by I 75.  First visit and felt comfortable and welcomed by staff.  Noise level good for conversation. 
Salad fresh and generous. Seafood medley pasta dish with good variety and plentiful seafood. 
Prices reasonable and notice there are frequent local coupons for this establishment.

data.title: A lot of Smoke, No Fire
data.text:
Valet parking, fancy building interior and out, plenty of staff yet still poor service. 

The food was decent, but the price did not justify it. However, I suppose it all comes down to what you want out of a restaurant. For me, I want good food and service. I could eat at a table like Lady & the Tramp if the food is delicious. Fancy valet and decor means little if the food and service is slow and overpriced.

data.title: Unrewarding
data.text: The room is well appointed but dated and void of guests.  The food was, expensive, disappointing, and the service just so so. One could get the same type of over processed food with too much garlic and rosemary at an Olive Garden for less money, (not that I would go to an Olive Garden). We were a group of 6, 3 siblings and our spouses that made a choice to visit this restaurant on May 31, we will not be back. I strongly encourage anyone that is considering visiting this establishment to rethink their choice and look elsewhere.

data.title: Elegant escape for office lunch break
data.text:
This is a very nice Italian restaurant that is a welcome break from the usual quick casual stops for lunch break.  There are not a ton of choices near my office especially warm, dark and cozy spaces where I can take a mental break from the stress of the office.

I love the fresh hot bread and olive oil served while I wait for the WOOD GRILLED SALMON SALAD.
Grilled salmon, spring mix with roasted almonds, Gorgonzola cheese and dried cranberries with Raspberry vinaigrette.

It's delicious!  I also love this spot for a mid afternoon romantic lunch break to take me away for just a moment....

I highly recommend.

data.title: Excellent Food, Service and location
data.text: Wonderful food experience. We had the Salmon and Filet. Both were served as ordered and the the flavor was excellent. Service was great, very nice atmosphere with large booths. great location to get to from I-75 and parking was easy.

data.title: Just Mediocre
data.text: My boyfriend and I got take out from here earlier this week. He had the chicken Alfredo and I had veal marsala. We also got some deep fried ravioli. The best part of our meal was the salad and the bread and everything else was just mediocre and over priced. The salad dressing was great and I'd order just a salad from there again.

data.title: OK, nothing special
data.text:
Bar setup is good for a drink. Food was just OK.

We had the Chicken Caprese Salad and the Lasagna. Neither either bad or good or memorable. Unlikely to go back,

data.title: Birthday party
data.text: We had a great time food and service was the best I had the roman chicken and it was fantastic also great selection of wine every on loved their food

data.title: Missed the mark
data.text: I ordered the eggplant and it was severely overcooked...practically mush. My coworker ordered the cobb salad and was thrilled with her meal. The ambiance was great and service spot on. Too bad my food was just ok.

data.title: Outstanding Italian Fare served in an intimate dining room
data.text: We have enjoyed several evenings at Loccino's over the years and this latest time was outstanding as always.  This occasion was the final meal after a successful business meeting for about a dozen execs and the staff's efforts to make our evening very special succeeded completely.  The service is first rate in all respects and the food delightfully presented and very well prepared Italian dishes.   A great place to unwind with a good friend or loved one!

data.title: Good Atmosphere
data.text: Pretty good homemade Italian food at a reasonable price. Be sure to use a coupon found in local magazines and the Entertainment Book

data.title: Delicious food and warm atmosphere
data.text: This is the second time for me. Both times the food was delicious. I was worried about the service based on other reviews but it was acceptable. No problem the first time but this past time it was extremely slow. That said, the food truly is wonderful. The delicate sauces are just extraordinary. The atmosphere is warm and inviting with white tablecloths and interesting art on the walls. This is a perfect place for a night out.

data.title: A miss in all areas.
data.text: We had good hopes for our experience at Loccino. Unfortunately, our hopes were met with disappointment throughout our meal.  While the restaurant was largely empty, we had extremely slow service.  Our drink orders took 20 minutes to fill, although  we were seated near the bar.  This was only the beginning as all aspects of our experience were slow at best.  This is acceptable if the food is worth the wait.  However, the food delivered was average at best. Out waiter clearly had better things to do than focus on his table.  This was capped off by the valet handing us our keys and not driving the car to pick us up.  There are far better places to dine and spend an evening in metro Detroit (in the same price range).  As a result, we will not be back.

data.title: Great Service
data.text: Close to hotels and highways - yet feels private and out of the way.  We all enjoyed our dinner; lots of options

data.title: Very Dissapointing!
data.text: We have eaten here in the past and always had a good experience until our last visit. We had a reservation for eight yet they were going to seat us at a terrible table until we asked for something better. Cocktails were ordered. Three of four were poorly made and one glass of rancid wine was served. Incorrect orders were served and had to be corrected, and the food was disappointing. Tasteless salads, fishy shrimp and uninspired pasta. Definitely not worth the price. We won't be back again anytime soon.

data.title: True comfort spot!
data.text: Very pleasurable experience! Greeted by friendly staff.Attended by comfortable wait staff. Delighted by sensual culinary adventures! You have to try it!!!
